org.flowvisor.events

Interface FVEventHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExampleHandler, OFSwitchAcceptor, OriginalSwitch, TopologyConnection, TopologyController, WorkerSwitch

    public interface FVEventHandler
    Basic processing module for message passing in FV
    Author:
    capveg

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      Return a human readable string (no spaces) that describes this handler
      long getThreadContext()
      Returns an integer that identifies the threading context that this handler runs in
      void handleEvent(FVEvent e)
      Pass a message to this Handler.
      boolean needsAccept()
      Return true if this Event handler wants accept events
      boolean needsConnect()
      Return true if this Event handler wants connect events
      boolean needsRead()
      Return true if this Event handler wants read events
      boolean needsWrite()
      Return true if this Event handler wants write events
      void tearDown()
      Tell the Handler to stop what it's doing and clean up all of its state

    • Method Detail

      • handleEvent

        void handleEvent(FVEvent e)
                 throws UnhandledEvent
        Pass a message to this Handler. If the dst is in the same thread context as the caller, the message is processed immediately (blocking) Else, the message is queued and processed later (non-blocking) If sender is null, the message is always queued
        Parameters:
        e - A FVEvent
        Throws:
        UnhandledEvent

      • getThreadContext

        long getThreadContext()
        Returns an integer that identifies the threading context that this handler runs in
        Returns:
        A long that identifies this thread

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Return a human readable string (no spaces) that describes this handler
        Returns:
        String

      • tearDown

        void tearDown()
        Tell the Handler to stop what it's doing and clean up all of its state
